result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • John R Juliet was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 94 days, if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel Meeting on either August 20, 2014 or the following one, or 30 days jail alternate.

miscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Blood draw tests to be paid to Waukesha Circuit and will be forwarded to City of Muskego Police Dept. (paid as a Condition of Probation.)
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug/urine screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner prescribed.
DNA surcharge WAIVED.
Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week and obtain a sponsor with 1 month of release.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - nonworking hours with standard release conditions.
COMMENCE FORTHWITH. After 6 months, and upon written request of the defendant, the Court would consider staying the remainder of the Condition Time to Day Report.

Defendant John R Juliet in court, in custody, with attorney Robert W. Buckett.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Sam Wegleitner, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 6 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years).  STAYED.  Credit for 94 days if revoked. 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on either August 20, 2014 or the following one, or 30 days jail consecutive.
- Fine of $1,393.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Muskego Police Department
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week and obtain a sponsor within 1 month of release.  

CONDITION TIME: 1 year - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith.  After 6 months, and upon written request of the defendant, the Court would consider staying the remainder of the condition time for Day Reporting.
